channel.title: Need help with model files
channel.description: ok so i have my .mdl files... what do i do now? i have: metaseq and dat maker 1. Do i need anything else? (programs) 2. What format has the model file have to be ( .gz or .dat) or does it even matter? Or is .gz only used for items and npcs that consist of more than 1 model?(some platebodies and npcs) 3. What do i need to replace the ##### with in "add model #####" .dat file or the id i found with rsmv or something else?

item.title: Need help with model files

item.description:
@illslayu wrote:

Taharok:

Moved to the correct section. Please use a more appropriate title next time.

well i only used that kind of title since i usually get no answers…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with model files
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

You name the “.dat” file you made with the ID you want to use. ie 8001.dat
(datmaker can handle .mdl and .dat, same format, different extension - only makes .dat though)
gzip it then rename the 8001.dat.gz to 8001.gz
put the 8001.gz in the correct folder…depends what code you wrote.
Then run client and the “add model #####” becomes add model 8001
Try something Simple to start with.

Read full topic

ok so i have my .mdl files… what do i do now? i have: metaseq and dat maker

  1. Do i need anything else? (programs)
  2. What format has the model file have to be ( .gz or .dat) or does it even matter? Or is .gz only used for items and npcs that consist of more than 1 model?(some platebodies and npcs)
  3. What do i need to replace the ##### with in “add model #####” .dat file or the id i found with rsmv or something else?
